queries.name: Simple query - all users
queries.query: query { users { id name email age } }
queries.expected: Array of users with all fields

queries.name: Query with argument
queries.query: query { user(id: 1) { id name email age } }

queries.name: Query with variable
queries.query: query GetUser($userId: Int!) { user(id: $userId) { id name email age } }

queries.name: Multiple fields query
queries.query: query { users { id name } posts { id title } }
queries.expected: Users with limited fields and all posts

queries.name: Posts by author
queries.query: query { postsByAuthor(authorId: 1) { id title content authorId } }
queries.expected: All posts by author with id 1

queries.name: Create user mutation
queries.query: mutation { createUser(name: "Test User", email: "test@example.com", age: 25) { id name email age } }

queries.name: Create user with variables
queries.query: mutation CreateUser($name: String!, $email: String!, $age: Int) { createUser(name: $name, email: $email, age: $age) { id name email age } }

queries.name: Update user mutation
queries.query: mutation { updateUser(id: 1, name: "Updated Name", age: 35) { id name email age } }

queries.name: Create post mutation
queries.query: mutation { createPost(title: "New Post", content: "Post content here", authorId: 1) { id title content authorId } }

queries.name: Named query operation
queries.query: query GetAllData { users { id name } posts { id title } }
queries.expected: Users and posts with named operation

queries.name: Complex nested selection
queries.query: query { users { id name email age } }

queries.name: Invalid query - syntax error
queries.expected: Error: Parse error with detailed message

curl_examples.command: curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "query { users { id name email } }"}'
curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "query GetUser($userId: Int!) { user(id: $userId) { id name } }", "variables": {"userId": 1}}'
curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "mutation { createUser(name: \"John\", email: \"john@test.com\", age: 28) { id name } }"}'
